entry.title: ECT-243116 - isPrimary field enhancement when using API
entry.content: Does the enhancement to the isPrimary field also impact the way we can update data via API calls? So, if we send over a business email address and flag it as primary, will it automatically set the private email addres to non-primary?

entry.title: Difficulty Triggering Workflow in SuccessFactors When Data Is Auto-Posted from BTP
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m working on an integration where contract end data is auto-posted from SAP BTP to SuccessFactors (SF) . The data is being posted into the Resignation portlet, and I want to trigger a workflow in SF when this happens. But, the workflow is not getting triggered when the data is posted from BTP. 

Thanks,
Sakshi

We have a MDF object that needs to go through workflows and be approved by multiple people. However, in the object there's a field that needs to be updated once the workflow has completed and the object has been approved.

Please help!

entry.title: Pay Range in Job Requisition
entry.content:
We are looking to map the Pay Range in EC to the Job Requisition fields, but we are facing a challenge due to the fact that the pay ranges have different minimum, maximum, and midpoint values. Also, this pay ranges is not maintained in position, hence we need to create a basic rule. Below is an example of the pay ranges we are working with:

Example Pay Ranges:

Pay Range ID: Pay Range 1

  • Minimum Pay 1: 43,200
  • Maximum Pay 1: 64,800
  • Mid Point 1: 54,000
  • Minimum Pay 2: 44,800
  • Maximum Pay 2: 67,200
  • Mid Point 2: 56,000
  • Minimum Pay 3: 44,800
  • Maximum Pay 3: 67,200
  • Mid Point 3: 56,000

Expected Mapping in Job Requisition:

When a recruiter selects a specific Pay Range ID in the Job Requisition, the following fields should be mapped as follows:

If Pay Range 1 is selected:

  • ABS Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 1 (43,200)
  • ABS Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 1 (54,000)
  • ABS Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 1 (64,800)
  • TTC Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 2 (44,800)
  • TTC Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 2 (56,000)
  • TTC Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 2 (67,200)
  • TDC Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 3 (44,800)
  • TDC Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 3 (56,000)
  • TDC Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 3 (67,200)

Question:

Is it possible to implement this mapping dynamically using a rule in EC? Specifically, we want the rule to be easy to maintain and automatically update whenever the Pay Range in EC changes. This would prevent the need for manually updating the rule in the requisition each time the Pay Ranges are updated.

If this is feasible, could you please provide guidance on how to configure such a rule?

Your assistance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Job Profile Builder - Position Selection
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I identified that enabling the Job Profile Builder activated two new objects: Family and Role.

Through the Job Profile Builder, we created the links between Family > Role > Job Code.

However, the client is requesting that during position creation, the Job Code should be selectable based on the configuration we have in the Job Profile Builder.

Example:
Family: Human Resources
Role: HR Generalist
Job Code: HR Analyst I

However, this is not working as expected — it seems that the Job Profile Builder operates separately and does not have any direct correlation with the Position object. I also tried to create associations between Family – Role – Job Code, but it’s still not working as intended.

Here’s an example below:

Thank you in advance,

entry.content:

① Does this upgrade not apply to the “Attribute Type” list screen that appears first when accessing the Growth Portfolio?
In other words, will filtering and sorting not be implemented on the “Attribute Type” list screen?
 the “Attribute Type” list screen is as follows.



② Is it possible for administrators to set the default sort order (i.e., the order before users apply their own sort settings)?
If not, what would the default sort order be (e.g., ascending by Name)?

Our clients have a strong interest in the display order of attributes within the growth portfolio, so we would like to ask you about this.

Best regards,

entry.title: Event trigger on post save, when LOA is entered in Job information portlet
entry.content:
Hello!

We have a requirement to trigger an ISC event whenever a Leave of Absence (LOA) or Return to Work (RTW) entry is made in the Job Information portlet.

Currently, the Leave Admin enters the LOA on behalf of the employee, which immediately sets the leave request to an Approved status. Because the request does not transition from Pending to Approved, the business rule is not triggered as expected.

Here’s a breakdown of the process:

  1. Leave Admin enters the LOA directly for the employee, setting the request to Approved.
  2. This action creates an LOA event in the Job Information portlet.
  3. Expected Behavior: A business rule should trigger on the post-save event based on changes in the Job Information model.
  4. Expected Outcome: The business rule should initiate an ISC event.
  5. Once triggered, the ISC event should send the required data to CPI via Integration Center.

Challenge: Since the LOA is entered directly in an approved state, the usual status transition that triggers the business rule does not occur.

Do you have any suggestions or workarounds to ensure the business rule and ISC event are triggered correctly in this scenario?

Any inputs or suggestions are greatly appreciated!

-Swathi

entry.title: How to make a pay scale level inactive.
entry.content: I am trying to make a pay scale level inactive, buy there is no option to do so in Manage data. I tried to make a correction, but there is no option to change it to have an end date. I do not want to delete the level for historical purposes.

entry.title: Can I Skip a SAP SuccessFactors Stay Current Assessment and Renew With the Next Release?
entry.content:
Dear Team,

My SAP SuccessFactors certification  (8X since 2017)  is valid until August 2026.

 

With the new SAP policy requiring annual renewal via stay current assessments, I want to know:

Can I skip the upcoming stay current assessment (for 2H 2025) and instead just take the next available one (for 1H 2026) before my certification expiry in August 2026?

Will skipping a release affect my certification validity as long as I renew before my expiry date?

As an Independent Consultant/Architect, I need to invest on Learning Hub myself , that is why I've asked .According to this I need to plan and allocate budget for it.

I tried and checked in Perplexity, got below answers  but I want to get 100 % trusted answers from SAP Official sources?

 

Perplexity says :

Yes, it is allowed to skip the 2H 2025 stay current assessment and appear directly for the 1H 2026 assessment, as long as your certification does not expire in the interim. Your SAP SuccessFactors certifications remain valid until their mentioned expiry in August 2026, provided you complete the necessary stay current or renewal assessment before expiry.

Key Points on SAP SF Certification Renewal

  • SAP SF certifications are now valid for 12 months at a time but can be extended yearly by completing the stay current/delta assessment for the next release.

  • The stay current assessment (linked to each release) is mandatory to push your expiry date forward by another year.

  • Skipping a release: You are not obliged to take every delta assessment (each half-yearly release). You only need to pass the latest available stay current assessment before your certification expires.  (Need clarification on this point)

  • If you skip 2H 2025, you can take the 1H 2026 assessment directly before your expiry date in August 2026, and your certification will be renewed.

Practical Guidance

  • Monitor expiry dates on your SAP Learning Hub dashboard and SAP Universal ID.

  • You will receive automated reminders before your certification expiry.

  • If your certification expires before you complete a stay current assessment, you will need to pass the full exam again to re-certify.

  • Unlimited attempts are allowed for most stay current assessments within the valid term.

Summary Table

Scenario                                            Is It Allowed?                                Certification Validity
Skip 2H 2025, take 1H 2026Yes, if before expiry dateExtended on passing 1H 2026 assessment
Miss expiry deadlineNo, must retake full examCertification lapses
 
 
Best regards,
Dr. Niladri Bihari Nayak
Enterprise Architect
Architecting for a Better World!

entry.title: Can I Skip a SAP SuccessFactors Stay Current Assessment and Renew With the Next Release?
entry.content:
Dear Friends,

My SAP SuccessFactors certification (8X since 2017) is valid until August 2026.

With the new SAP policy requiring annual renewal via stay current assessments, I want to know: Can I skip the upcoming stay current assessment (for 2H 2025) and instead just take the next available one (for 1H 2026) before my certification expiry in August 2026?

Will skipping a release affect my certification validity as long as I renew before my expiry date?

I know upskilling is essential but being an Independent Enterprise Architect, I need to optimize my investments on SAP Learning Hub as it is self-sponsored by me. So I asked this question, otherwise if it is partner sponsored , you must go through all Delta exams . 

 

Best regards,
Dr. Niladri Bihari Nayak
Enterprise Architect
Architecting for a Better World!

entry.title: pay range for monthly frequency employees
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Need your advise on one urgent case:

We are using Annualized planning (meaning cur

We are using Annual planning for the Total Compensation merit planning (where we are using Annualiedsalary pay comp group for curSalary and all increase fields like merit, extra, promotion are in annual values).  I have both Current Pay Rate (custom field) and curSalary (Annualizedsalary) shown in the form.

My client requirement is to display Salary range values for Monthly employees in monthly amounts and annual employees in annual amounts. The range values are loaded in Pay range table in that way. 

Scenario 1:

When in Pay Range table I do not maintain the standard frequency, worksheet is able to fetch the correct min max range values, but range penetration is wrong (highly inflated in both worksheet and EC Comp Info)

                                        

Scenario 2:

When I maintain the standard Frequency field, the worksheet shows NA against min max range values and Range penetration. But is calculating correctly in EC Comp Info.

       

 

EC Comp Info                                                                                                                

           

Comp Worksheet                      

Need your advise please.

 

Many Thanks,

Swagatika

@xavierlegarrec

entry.title: BW/4HANA connection to SuccessFactors using Compoundemployee soap API instead Odata API
entry.content:
Hello Team,

W want use Compoundemployee soap API instead Odata API instead of SF Odata API to connect BW/4HANA to SuccessFactors using the DP agent.

the reason is : OdataAdapter required for SF Odata API is not supported any more to run on the DP agent and it has to run in DP server in SAP HANA Database. meantime the direct connection from SAP HANA DB to SF is not allowed and it has to be through DP agent installed in a separate machine.

the DP agent , we can use SoapAdapter and use Compoundemployee Soap API instead to extract data from SF to BW/4HANA.

Appreciate your confirmation if we can use Soap API instead of OData API please  to connect BW/4HANA to SuccessFactors through SAP Data Provisioning Agent

entry.title: Read audit report for potential mass breach
entry.content: From an audit team at a client I got the following request: How do we audit the situation that RBP was incorrectly configured opening the system up for all employees potentially seeing data for colleagues that they should not have access to (e.g., see salary information). The read audit report only allows for 10 employees to be checked per run. It is not an option to run the report hundreds or even thousands of times to verify nobody actually accessed data they should not be allowed to see.

entry.title: Story Reports – Combine Holiday and Timesheet data without a direct query relationship
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am building a monthly Timesheet Story Report in SAP SuccessFactors Report Center, based on the Recorded Time Data (V2) query.

Goal:
Generate a monthly timesheet per employee, showing all attendance and absence types — with columns such as:

  • Date
  • Start Time
  • End Time
  • Quantity in hours
  • Time Type (working time, vacation, sick leave, holiday, etc.)

Problem:
The Recorded Time Data (V2) table does not contain entries for public holidays.
The Holiday data exists separately and can only be reached through the User → Employee Information → Job Information path.
However, when trying to connect those datasets in Story Reports, the query expands uncontrollably — generating huge amounts of redundant data, to the point where nothing meaningful can be displayed or analyzed.

I have checked all other available query tables and possible combinations — there are no tables that can directly connect or combine both employee timesheet (Recorded Time Data) and holiday information in a way that provides usable, consistent data.

Additional context:

  • No Time Tracking license → cannot use Time Valuations.
  • Absence Counting Configuration is not useful for this case.
  • I only need this for reporting (not payroll integration).

Questions:

  1. Is there any supported way to bring Recorded Time Data (V2) and Holiday data together into the same Story Report?
    For example, can this be achieved if I add both tables as two separate data sources, where the only common field between them is the Date column (without any direct relationship through Employee or Job Information)?
  2. Can I use any formula or calculated column in Recorded Time Data to identify or return Holiday dates?

Any ideas, workarounds, or model design suggestions would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!
